meanings.definition: A group of people or things arranged in a particular order or sequence.
meanings.sent1: The ordo of books on the shelf was organized by color.
meanings.sent2: The teacher asked the students to line up in ordo from shortest to tallest.
meanings.sent3: The ordo of ducks following each other in a line made the children giggle.
meanings.sent4: The ordo of cars waiting at the traffic light resembled a colorful parade.
meanings.sent5: The ordo of numbered boxes made it easy to find the right one.

meanings.sent1: The monks belonged to a peaceful ordo in the mountains.
meanings.sent2: She decided to join the ordo of nuns to dedicate her life to service.
meanings.sent3: The ordo of monks had a bake sale to raise funds for charity.
meanings.sent4: The ordo of priests gathered for a solemn ceremony in the cathedral.
meanings.sent5: The ordo of worshippers sang hymns together in harmony.

meanings.definition: A class or category of things having common characteristics.
meanings.sent1: In the animal kingdom, the feline ordo includes lions and tigers.
meanings.sent2: The ordo of flowers in the garden added a burst of color.
meanings.sent3: The ordo of desserts on the menu made it hard to choose just one.
meanings.sent4: The ordo of planets in our solar system is fascinating to study.
meanings.sent5: The ordo of musical instruments in the orchestra created beautiful melodies.
